comments.text: this building has a continuous shop front around the corner
comments.html: this building has a continuous shop front around the corner

comments.text: I'd hardly describe it as a continuous shopfront. There is a roller shutter concealing a shopfront across most of the width at the Friern Barnet side. There is a small roller shutter about 4 feet across the corner bevel, concealing an entrance door. The Carlton Road side is mostly hidden by an advertising hoarding -- maybe there is a storefront behind it, but the hoarding looks fairly permanent. The shutters were down (at 3pm in the afternoon) so I think the shop may not be in current use. Consequently I'm just adding the corner bevel, adjusting the perimeter to be more like that on bing but not adding any shop details unless somebody cares to re-open this.
comments.html: I'd hardly describe it as a continuous shopfront. There is a roller shutter concealing a shopfront across most of the width at the Friern Barnet side. There is a small roller shutter about 4 feet across the corner bevel, concealing an entrance door. The Carlton Road side is mostly hidden by an advertising hoarding -- maybe there is a storefront behind it, but the hoarding looks fairly permanent. The shutters were down (at 3pm in the afternoon) so I think the shop may not be in current use. Consequently I'm just adding the corner bevel, adjusting the perimeter to be more like that on bing but not adding any shop details unless somebody cares to re-open this.

comments.text:
This is not Trumpers Field. Trumpers Field is correctly shown in it's proper location approx. 500m to the north.

This bit of land is known by the local Council as "Earl of Jersey's Field"
comments.html:

comments.text: Yep that was me. I used to run across this area (seemingly an old municipal dumping ground, now a large area of rough grass) and knew it as Trumpers Field but as there is little/nothing in the way of signage on the ground I may well have been confused. I agree that the proper location of Trumpers Field would seem to be the north but I have never heard the name "Earl of Jersey's Field" at all so I'm not so sure about that.
comments.html: Yep that was me. comments.text: laura passport office

comments.text:
Thanks for your note, but the passport office is already present on OpenStreetMap.

The notes feature of OpenStreetMap allows both registered users and the wider public to quickly indicate where there are errors or omissions in the OpenStreetMap data, and for contributors to OpenStreetMap to know where their support is needed http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Notes  If you just wanted to share a link with a marker, this possible using the 'share' button http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Browsing#Sharing_a_link_to_the_maps
comments.html:
Thanks for your note, but the passport office is already present on OpenStreetMap.

The notes feature of OpenStreetMap allows both registered users and the wider public to quickly indicate where there are errors or omissions in the OpenStreetMap data, and for contributors to OpenStreetMap to know where their support is needed http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Notes If you just wanted to share a link with a marker, this possible using the 'share' button http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Browsing#Sharing_a_link_to_the_maps

comments.text: These stops were added as part of an import using NaPTAN data, but it looks as though they have not been verified on the ground. If you are sure there are no stops there feel free to delete them. Accuracy based on a survey is the gold standard.

comments.text:
This is a Hail and Ride section -- which means there are no physical bus stops but the bus stops on request anywhere safe along the section. You can see it at http://content.tfl.gov.uk/bus-route-maps/alexandra-palace-a4.pdf

I'm not sure how we show H&R sections on OSM. The temptation is probably to say if you can't see a stop it shouldn't be listed, but if the stop name is actually used (eg it is shown by the LED indicators in the bus) then there might be reason for keeping the stops and inventing a new Hail tag.
comments.html:
This is a Hail and Ride section -- which means there are no physical bus stops but the bus stops on request anywhere safe along the section. You can see it at http://content.tfl.gov.uk/bus-route-maps/alexandra-palace-a4.pdf

I'm not sure how we show H&R sections on OSM. The temptation is probably to say if you can't see a stop it shouldn't be listed, but if the stop name is actually used (eg it is shown by the LED indicators in the bus) then there might be reason for keeping the stops and inventing a new Hail tag.

Our services include  include sink repairs, installing fixtures, drain cleaning, central heating repairs, the replacement of sinks and taps, water filter instillations, grease trap maintenance, water leak detection, septic systems repair and maintenance, water heater installation and much more. We at Plumbing Service Plumbers Ltd. are plumbers who can tackle any residential plumbing services and commercial plumbing services. comments.text:
The community centre is actually the majority of the building, with the church being only part of it.  (I volunteer there so I know what it's called).

I'm suggesting changing the place name from "Trinity-at-Bowes Methodist Church" to "Trinity-at-Bowes Methodist Church & Centre Plus" at least.

Sorry if I'm not using the correct jargon.  I'm actually new to this OSM lark (even though I signed up years ago).  Thanks.
comments.html:
The community centre is actually the majority of the building, with the church being only part of it. (I volunteer there so I know what it's called).

I'm suggesting changing the place name from "Trinity-at-Bowes Methodist Church" to "Trinity-at-Bowes Methodist Church & Centre Plus" at least.

Sorry if I'm not using the correct jargon. I'm actually new to this OSM lark (even though I signed up years ago). Thanks.

comments.text: If there are two real-world objects (the community centre and the church) there should be two OSM objects. Having the building separate from what happens there is common, especially when more than one thing is in the building. You could tag the building as a building (remove the church stuff from teh building) and add two nodes one for the church and one for the community centre if that is a better reflection of the real world. Adding the nodes in roughly the right place inside the building is usual. Just changing the name really doesn't do it for me - but you know the place I don't.
comments.html: If there are two real-world objects (the community centre and the church) there should be two OSM objects. Having the building separate from what happens there is common, especially when more than one thing is in the building. You could tag the building as a building (remove the church stuff from teh building) and add two nodes one for the church and one for the community centre if that is a better reflection of the real world. Adding the nodes in roughly the right place inside the building is usual. Just changing the name really doesn't do it for me - but you know the place I don't.

comments.text: ... and don't be afraid to have a go. It can always be fixed later. Better to learn on stuff you know well. Click that edit button!!!
comments.html: ... and don't be afraid to have a go. It can always be fixed later. Better to learn on stuff you know well. Click that edit button!!!

comments.text: Thanks for your advice.  I will have a think and then have a go.  It's tricky as the centre is owned by and integrated with the church, but also is used by people who don't use the church, so I agree that separate nodes could be useful.
comments.html: Thanks for your advice. I will have a think and then have a go. It's tricky as the centre is owned by and integrated with the church, but also is used by people who don't use the church, so I agree that separate nodes could be useful.

comments.text: The front is accessible from the street. The West side is visible from the nearby footpath and is as shown. The rest of the site is hidden by the adjacent construction site and the rear only partially visible from a distance at Woodall Road. Looking at the website, there is mention of a new South Extension that I can check from the road. But to map this accurately without updated bing imagery, we probably need to persuade one of the senior students to join osm and take this on as a project.

Ben and Jerry Ltd
111 Mitcham Ln, SW16 6LY
020 8746 4455
office@benandjerry.org.uk

Ben and Jerry Ltd is a removal company specialized in a large variety of relocation services across the UK and internationally. We offer our customers only high quality SW16 services which are meant to fit their needs perfectly. These services are carried out only by highly trained personnel with years of experience and only by using the latest equipment when completing this task. Even if you have friends or neighbors who offered to help you with your removal, you have to understand that their help with packing and unpacking won`t be as useful when it comes to transporting your belongings to your new address. The conclusion to this is that the best option for your local relocation is to hire a man and a van service. So call us now on 020 8746 4455, or visit our website www.benandjerry.org.uk
